de.tud.kom.p2psim.overlay.bt
Class BTDocument

java.lang.Object
  de.tud.kom.p2psim.overlay.bt.BTDocument
All Implemented Interfaces:
Document
public class BTDocument
extends java.lang.Object
implements Document

This class represents the file, that the peers try to download. Like a real file, it has a size, a hash value (OverlayKey) and a download state. But it also handels very BitTorrent specific details: piece exponent and block exponent. These two are used for dividing the document in smaller parts.

Author:
Jan Stolzenburg

Nested Class Summary

          With this interface, other classes can be notified, if the download of a block finishes.

          With this interface, other classes can be notified, if the download finishes.

getDocumentState

public int getDocumentState()
Returns the state of the document: -1: Document is empty. 0: Document partially downloaded. +1: Document completelly downloaded.

Returns:
the state, one of the values: -1; 0; +1;

getPieceState

Returns the state of the piece: -1: Piece is empty. 0: Piece partially downloaded. +1: Piece completelly downloaded.

Parameters:
thePieceNumber - the number of the piece in the document.
Returns:

getBlockState

public int getBlockState(int thePieceNumber,
                         int theBlockNumber)
Returns the state of the block: -1: Block is not downloaded. +1: Block is downloaded.

Parameters:
thePieceNumber - the number of the piece in the document.
theBlockNumber - the number of the block in the piece.
Returns:
the state, one of the values: -1; +1;

addBlock

public void addBlock(int thePieceNumber,
                     int theBlockNumber)
Use this method, if an block gets downloaded. It will handle everything else for the document class.

Parameters:
thePieceNumber - The number of the piece, in which the downloaded block is located.
theBlockNumber - The number of the finished block.
